abstract: Federal appeals court unanimously rules that Washington State can force pharmacies to dispense emergency contraceptives, such as Plan B; decision overturns 2012 federal district court ruling that allowed pharmacies to send patients seeking emergency contraception elsewhere if pharmacy owner had religious objections.
lead_paragraph: Washington State can force pharmacies to dispense Plan B or other emergency contraceptives, a federal appeals court said.
snippet: Washington State can force pharmacies to dispense Plan B or other emergency contraceptives, a federal appeals court said.
